processCursorEvent

public void processCursorEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e,
                               int t)
Line object doesn't follow the cursor event processing specifed by its superclass GeometryShape. The difference lies in the processing when shift mask is present. Line will not always regulate its bounding rectangle to a square. There will be three cases: the bounding rectangle is either square, a horizontal line or a vertical line, depending the slope of the line. tan(30) = 0.577; tan(60) = 1.155;

Specified by:
processCursorEvent in interface IShape
Overrides:
processCursorEvent in class RectBoundedShape
Parameters:
e - the MouseEvent being detected.
t - the event type. can take values PRESSED, RELEASED, and DRAGGED.
